q: calling itself ''America's President Bush Committee'' has been established, seeking to draft one particular individual to run to be America's President Bush -- Rep. Mike Pence ( R-IN). months tells NRO the conservative Hoosier ''was extremely torn while he deliberated.'' Another who met with Mike Pence feels his heart was never completely in a bid for president. Someone close to Mike Pence explains that the people closest to him, the friends and people he knew best from Indiana, wanted to see him come back to Indiana. By contrast, ''the support for him to run nationally was in large part from leaders of the national conservative movement''- who perhaps didn't have the same sway as his longtime supporters. Eenvoudiger structeren Naarmate Google is gegroeid, is het managen van het bedrijf ingewikkelder geworden. Larry[ Page], Sergey Brin [ Sergey Brin ] en ik hebben een hoop gesproken over hoe de we management structuur eenvoudiger kunnen maken en beslissingen kunnen versnellen. Afgelopen kerst hebben we besloten dat dit het beste moment is om structurele veranderingen aan te brengen. ''De afgelopen 10 jaar hebben we allemaal een rol gehad bij het nemen van besluiten. the last few years- and it certainly has- much of blame falls on Eric Schmidt . His haughty, creepy, and occasionally insulting way of addressing the company's approach to privacy is notorious. Google policy is to get right up to the creepy line and not cross it, he once said, unwittingly showing that Google's policy is just the opposite.
